p: Essential oils (EOs) are usually extracted from aromatic plants by steam distillation and they are natural complex mixtures of many different low molecular weight compounds, such as terpenoids and phenylpropanoids [ 1, 2]. EOs are widely used in food preservation, agriculture and pharmaceutics, due to their anti-bacterial, anti-fungal, anti-oxidation and anti-inflammation properties [ 3, 4]. In recent years, the encapsulation of essential oils into polymeric nanofibres produced by electrospinning has gained increasing interests, because of the possibility of achieving a longer and more controlled release of those bioactive agents if compared with other delivery methods [ 5].
